articles.headline: How Politics Constrain the Federal Reserve and Other Economists
articles.snippet: Top economists will meet in Jackson, Wyo., this week for a meeting sponsored by the Kansas City Fed. But politicians gathering in France hold the real keys to the economic future.
articles.abstract: Top economists will meet in Jackson, Wyo., this week for a meeting sponsored by the Kansas City Fed. But politicians gathering in France hold the real keys to the economic future.
articles.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Wyo. — As top economists from around the globe gather for their annual conference at Jackson Hole this week, they will have a collective hope in mind: that the world’s political leaders will work to help safeguard economic growth.

articles.headline: Patrick Byrne, Overstock C.E.O., Resigns After Disclosing Romance With Russian Agent
articles.snippet: Mr. Byrne’s resignation came roughly a week after he publicly disclosed that he had a relationship with Maria Butina.
articles.abstract: Mr. Byrne’s resignation came roughly a week after he publicly disclosed that he had a relationship with Maria Butina.
articles.lead_paragraph: For two decades as the chief executive of the online retailer Overstock.com, Patrick Byrne has never been far from controversy.
articles.byline: By Cade Metz and Julie Creswell

articles.headline: How Wayne LaPierre Survived a Revolt at the N.R.A.
articles.snippet: Previously undisclosed documents reveal a sweeping effort by top officials and lawyers to oust the longtime head of the N.R.A. Not only has he remained, but he continues to influence the president.
articles.abstract: Previously undisclosed documents reveal a sweeping effort by top officials and lawyers to oust the longtime head of the N.R.A. Not only has he remained, but he continues to influence the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wayne LaPierre, the chief executive of the National Rifle Association, has confronted threats from all sides this year.

articles.headline: Hiring Is Very Hard for Restaurants These Days. Now They May Have to Fire.
articles.snippet: Amid a severe labor shortage and a renewed U.S. crackdown on undocumented immigrants, owners are facing a choice: fire workers or risk prosecution.
articles.abstract: Amid a severe labor shortage and a renewed U.S. crackdown on undocumented immigrants, owners are facing a choice: fire workers or risk prosecution.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facing one of the most severe labor shortages in decades, restaurants across the country are trying virtually everything to recruit cooks and dishwashers, from offering quarterly bonuses to providing training programs for ex-convicts.

articles.headline: Baby Food, Bassinets and Talk of Salvation: Inside an Evangelical Pregnancy Center
articles.snippet: The director used to attend anti-abortion protests. Now she tries to help pregnant women and new mothers find jobs, emotional support or a place to shower.
articles.abstract: The director used to attend anti-abortion protests. Now she tries to help pregnant women and new mothers find jobs, emotional support or a place to shower.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT, Tenn. — Wendy Ramsey began her day as she often does, in the cool basement of Lincoln Avenue Baptist Church. It was a Thursday, and her first client was coming at noon. She flipped on the fluorescent lights.

articles.headline: Trump Says He Will Raise Existing Tariffs on Chinese Goods to 30%
articles.snippet: The president said he would raise tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese imports to 30 percent and would start the next $300 billion at a rate of 15 percent.
articles.abstract: The president said he would raise tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese imports to 30 percent and would start the next $300 billion at a rate of 15 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said he would increase taxes on all Chinese goods and demanded that American companies stop doing business with China as his anger toward Beijing and his Federal Reserve chair boiled over on Friday.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: David Koch, Billionaire Who Fueled Right-Wing Movement, Dies at 79
articles.snippet: A man-about-town philanthropist, he and his brother Charles ran a business colossus while furthering a libertarian agenda that reshaped American politics.
articles.abstract: A man-about-town philanthropist, he and his brother Charles ran a business colossus while furthering a libertarian agenda that reshaped American politics.

articles.headline: How Uber Got Lost
articles.snippet: The once-swaggering company is losing more money and growing more slowly than ever. What happened?
articles.abstract: The once-swaggering company is losing more money and growing more slowly than ever. What happened?
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is adapted from the book “Super Pumped: The Battle for Uber,” by Mike Isaac, a reporter for The New York Times. The book will be published by W.W. Norton & Co. on Sept. 3.
